content: The Act titled "Land Grants-Mercedes Conservation Program Eligibility Act of 2017" establishes eligibility criteria for the Land Grants-Mercedes program. The Land Grants-Mercedes Conservation Program Eligibility Act of 2017 defines "land grant-merced" as a community or town whose land was granted by the government of Spain or Mexico, or asserted title under the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo. The Act allows alternative funding arrangements for land grants through the Office of the Surveyor General for New Mexico or the United States Court of Private Land Claims. The Secretary can enter into alternative funding arrangements with land grant-merced under conservation programs if program goals are met and statutory limitations are not exceeded. Technical and administrative assistance may be provided as agreed upon. The Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to include "land grant-merced" in various conservation programs for Indian tribes.
